medical_history.chief_complaint: Request for assisted suicide following a diagnosis of terminal lung cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A, a 63-year-old lung cancer patient, expressed suicidal feelings after a diagnosis of terminal cancer. He indicated no interest in chemotherapy, made funeral arrangements shortly after his prognosis, and felt distraught over his condition. Despite receiving chemotherapy and antidepressants, he continued to express suicidal thoughts.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of depression with previous suicide attempts, including one after his mother's self-inflicted gunshot wound. Previously struggled with alcoholism but had been sober for over 20 years.
medical_history.family_history: His mother died by suicide; no other immediate family medical history specified.
medical_history.social_history: Lives alone, previously isolated himself from family. Has a daughter who postponed her graduate studies to help him following his disclosure of his cancer diagnosis.
